name: Kale, Cabbage, and Brussels Sprout Salad
author: Crystal S
summary: Hale and hearty, this kale salad is a powerhouse of nutrients that is very easy to eat! The salad bursts with the flavor of mandarin oranges, sweet and tart strawberries, and has a pleasant poppy seed dressing. When mangoes are in season, you can substitute them for the mandarin oranges or walnuts and pomegranates, toasted cashews or walnuts, and apples in the fall for different flavors. The possibilities are endless!
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 pound Brussels sprouts, trimmed and thinly sliced
1 ½ cups sweetened dried cranberries (such as Craisins®)
1 (15 ounce) can mandarin oranges, drained and sliced in half, or more to taste
4  fresh strawberries, sliced, or to taste  (Optional)
1 (12 ounce) bottle poppy seed salad dressing (such as Marie's®)
directions: Pour pepitas into a bowl and coat with cooking spray
Sprinkle cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper over pepitas and toss to coat
Cook and stir coated pepitas in a skillet over medium-low heat until lightly toasted and fragrant, about 5 minutes
Remove skillet from heat and allow pepitas to cool
Combine Brussels sprouts, curly kale, lacinato kale, napa cabbage, dried cranberries, mandarin oranges, green onions, strawberries, and toasted pepitas in a large bowl
Mix poppy seed dressing and orange juice together in a bowl; pour over Brussels sprouts mixture and toss well
